FOUND IN: Glutton - A person who overindulges in food or drink, often to excess.
Crimson - A rich, deep shade of red with slight purple tones.
Stuttering - A speech disorder characterized by repeated and involuntary sound repetitions or prolongations.
Sheikh (or Shiekh) - A title for an elder or leader of a tribe, clan, or religious group in Arab culture.
Sewing - Joining, attaching or repairing by using a needle and thread.
Tap - A device for controlling the release of liquid from a confined space, such as a water pipe or container.
Cryosphere (the collective term for all the Earth's frozen water; includes glaciers and other forms of slow-moving ice masses)
Sage - With its grayish foliage that feels soft to the touch, sage (Salvia officinalis) is an herb commonly used for culinary purposes and medicinal applications.
Hercule Poirot - Although not Belgian, this character was created by Agatha Christie and is often associated with Belgium due to his nationality
Square mile - A measure of area equal to one mile by one mile, or 640 acres.
